item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, April 12, 2025 at 4:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Open source and self hostable/private file converter (195 points | 45 comments)
2. Google will let companies run Gemini models in their own data centers (277 points | 92 comments)
3. Tunarr: Create and configure live TV channels from media on your servers (15 points | 4 comments)
4. One Bug Wasn't Enough: Escalating Twice Through SAP's Setuid Landscape (21 points | 1 comment)
5. Delusional themes may be more varied than we thought (25 points | 16 comments)
6. Rust to C compiler – 95.9% test pass rate, odd platforms (218 points | 136 comments)
7. Yakread's Ranking Algorithm (51 points | 7 comments)
8. Vacheron Constantin breaks the world record for most complicated wristwatch (264 points | 253 comments)
9. "Slow Pay, Low Pay or No Pay": Blue Cross Approved Surgeries Then Refused to Pay (105 points | 90 comments)
10. You might not need WebSockets (333 points | 207 comments)
11. Google Is Winning on Every AI Front (590 points | 458 comments)
12. Fedora change aims for 99% package reproducibility (386 points | 189 comments)
13. Intentionally Making Close Friends (2021) (256 points | 61 comments)
14. Instant (YC S22) Is Hiring a Founding TypeScript Engineer ( | hide)
15. Adobe deletes Bluesky posts after backlash (443 points | 540 comments)
16. Why 'Prince Rupert's Drop' Glass Is Strong Enough to Shatter a Bullet (2023) (46 points | 16 comments)
17. Apple, Nvidia, Dell, and Others Get a Tariffs Exemption Under New Rules (141 points | 142 comments)
18. Roo or Cline? We're building a superset (3 points | discuss)
19. C++: terser (shorter) lambda == SHORTY (ab-use?) (41 points | 13 comments)
20. A 32-bit processor made with an atomically thin semiconductor (202 points | 39 comments)
21. Erlang's not about lightweight processes and message passing (2023) (289 points | 156 comments)
22. AI can't stop making up software dependencies and sabotaging everything (142 points | 107 comments)
23. Blue Prince is a roguelike puzzle masterpiece (166 points | 97 comments)
24. Ames Shovel and Tool Catalog of Shovels, Spades and Scoops (1926) [pdf] (32 points | 11 comments)
25. Once lush Sahara was home to a surprisingly unique group of humans (120 points | 24 comments)
26. The AI magic behind Sphere's upcoming 'The Wizard of Oz' experience (3 points | 1 comment)
27. WebRTC for the Curious (180 points | 33 comments)
28. Bonobos use a kind of syntax once thought to be unique to humans (175 points | 110 comments)
29. Windows 2000 Server named peak Microsoft (194 points | 255 comments)
30. Every picture from Venus' surface, ever (2021) (77 points | 10 comments)
